name: Saiyan
overview: A naturally aggressive warrior race hailing from the planet Vegeta who are, purportedly, the strongest warriors in the fictional Dragon Ball universe. Most of the Saiyans were exterminated by galactic overlord Frieza after Goku was born. With only few known survivors, they are functionally extinct. With the exception of their monkey-like tails, all Saiyans have an outward appearance identical to humans but with a larger, muscular build. They are able to manipulate life energy and are able to sense said energy from other living beings

name: Samaan
overview: An alien race who are terminally dependent on a Mother AI.[1] One of them, Lala Hagoromo, became the first alien to become a Pretty Cure.[2]

name: Santeeians
overview: Santeeians worshipped Wankershim before being vaporized to become one with Wankershim.

name: Sathar
overview: Worm-like tentacled antagonists

name: Scarrans
overview: Humanoid

name: Scorvians
overview: Humanoid

name: Screwheads
overview: They were enslaved by the Irken Empire and currently the species works the Conveyor Belt Planet.

name: Scwozzworts
overview: Squid-like and non-humanoid

name: Sdanli
overview: Large, fierce reptilian predators native to Home. In the very ancient history of the Race, petitioners who appeared before emperors (Ssumaz dynasty or otherwise, as this was long before the planet's political unification even by the standards of the Race's history) and did not show the proper respect were thrown to sdanli as a form of capital punishment. The punishment was later changed to a nonlethal, symbolic one: courtiers in sdanli-skin masks surround the disgraced individuals and mock them.

name: Sebaceans
overview: Humanoid. Genetically engineered offshoot of humans, harvested from Earth 27,000 years ago. Lower heat resistance than humans, but double the average life expectancy

name: Second through Last Men
source: Olaf Stapledon's Last and First Men

name: Sectoids
overview: Sectoids are the first race encountered by the X-COM. They resemble the typical Grey alien, but are quite short. However, they have great psychic powers, capable of linking their minds and inducing panic or even controlling their enemies.

name: Selay
overview: Reptilian species in episode "Lonely Among Us"

name: Selkath
overview: Humanoid

name: Séroni
overview: Humanoid

name: Sevod
overview: An avian species with reptilian characteristics that flew in the sky of Tau Ceti. Like many creatures found in Home, they had scales and eye-turrets; unlike birds, sevod and related species had featherless wings. The Sevod was renowned for making musical sounds in the evening and are related to squazeffi.

name: Shadows
overview: Arachnid, capable of phase-shifting to turn invisible

name: Sheeda
source: Grant Morrison's Seven soldiers of Victory megaseries

name: Shi'ar
overview: Humanoid

name: Shizuka Minamoto (Parallel Planet on the contrary)
overview: Humanoid who is the gender-swapped version of Shizuka Minamoto

name: Sholans
overview: Feline humanoid

name: Shongairi
source: David Weber's Out of the Dark

name: Shroobs
overview: Evil race of Toads who invaded the Mushroom Kingdom of the past. Some of them appears in Bowser's Castle in Mario & Luigi: Bowser's Inside Story.

name: Silfen
overview: Humanoid

name: Skinnies
overview: Humanoid

name: Skolarians
source: Zak McKracken and the Alien Mindbenders

name: Skroderiders
source: Vernor Vinge's A Fire Upon the Deep
overview: Sessile, plant-like beings mounted in personal mechanical vehicles ("skrodes")

name: Slaughtering Rat People
overview: Physiologically similar to giant rats, the Slaughtering Rat People inhabited the planet Blorch before it was conquered by Invader Skoodge. Blorch was converted into a parking structure planet.

name: Snotlings
overview: Humanoid

name: SoI-002
overview: Species of Interest #002 is a large, conical, arthropodal species with four legs and six arms, locomoting with self-assistance via telekinesis. Most if not all members of the species are Ortothans; practitioners of an ancient intergalactic religion. SCP-2651-B, a group of SoI-002, died while attempting to colonize the Earth during the late Neoproterozoic Era. In sandbox notes, the species is unofficially labeled as the Aalkjad.

name: Solrock
overview: A rock-like Pokémon reminiscent of a cartoon sun.

name: Sonorosians
overview: Sound-based aliens from planet Sonorosia who live in containment suits made of silicon, they are capable of self replication and unleashing powerful sonic screams.

name: Sontarans
overview: Stocky humanoids known for their ruthlessness from planet Sontar.

name: Sosiqui
source: The Journeyman Project 3: Legacy of Time

name: Southern Aliens
overview: They have thick southern accents.

name: Space Chickens
overview: Physiologically similar to pigeons

name: Species
overview: Bipedal humanoid female aliens, and quadrupedal male aliens.

name: Spirits
overview: Humanoid

name: Splixson
overview: Small, humanoid aliens from planet Hathor, Splixsons can duplicate themselves infinitely, and are generally peaceful farmers and painters on their home planet.

name: Ssora
overview: Reptilian

name: Ssvapi
overview: A burrowing animal native to Rabotev 2. Throughout the Race's empire, they are notorious for showing extreme aggression and stubbornness in fighting to defend their burrow networks against predators and other intruders. The American defense of Chicago from 1942 to 1944 was compared to the territorial defensiveness of such animals by the Conquest Fleet that flew against Tosev 3.

name: Sugarbellies
overview: They speak in high-pitched voices.

name: Suliban
overview: Humanoid

name: Sun-Dog
source: Terry Pratchett's The Dark Side of the Sun
overview: Large sentient beings that live in the vacuum of space. Capable of traveling through hyperspace. Any object they engulf will travel through hyperspace with them. The Sub-Dog species operate a successful business transporting spaceships across vast distances for other races in exchange for currency.

name: Suneo Honekawa (Parallel Planet on the contrary)
overview: Humanoid who is the gender-swapped version of Suneo Honekawa

name: Serrakin
overview: Humanoid

name: Sycorax
overview: Humanoid

name: Sykarians
overview: Humanoid

name: Symbiote
overview: Inorganic, amorphous extraterrestrial symbiotes appearing in American comic books published by Marvel Comics. The Klyntar bond with their hosts, creating a symbiotic bond through which a single entity is created. They also are able to alter their hosts personalities, by influencing their darkest desires and wants, along with amplifying their physical and emotional traits and personality.

name: Syreen
overview: Humanoid
